intro: Centaurea sloupnicensis, commonly known as the Sloupnice thistle, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is native to the mountainous regions of the Czech Republic and is characterized by its spiny leaves and purple to pink flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry habitats, showcasing its adaptability to harsh environments. It has small, narrow leaves with a rough texture and produces composite flower heads that attract various pollinators. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species within its native range.
